candidates.name: Jack Gielen
candidates.why_elect: I stand for family4justice and suicide prevention promoting the preciousness of life.
candidates.why_stand: Because i am a truther and a socialist believing in the jubilee principle of equality and justice.

candidates.name: Brad Hills
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Hamilton for over thirty years and been involved in many aspects of our city, such as sport, school, university, and employment. This involvement has allowed me to build relationships with a diverse range of Hamiltonians and given me insight into what our city needs.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that our city is not living up to its full potential. Our environment and many of our people are suffering, and our rates keep going up with what seems to be little to show for it. It is time for a change. I will help bring that change.

candidates.name: Garry Mallett
candidates.why_elect: I clearly understand what is Council's role and what is not. I've a strong respect for the rights of our citizens. I fully respect that when Council spends money it's spending ratepayers' money. Council must be super, super clear that ratepayers are getting great value when Council spends their money.
candidates.why_stand: I have a clear vision of Hamilton as a city lead by its citizens. Council's responsibility is to: (1) enable critical core infrastructure to develop homes, business and prosperity (2) enact light-handed regulation that maintains civic order but doesn't suppress creativity or ambition (3) always ensures outstanding value for ratepayers.

candidates.name: Kesh Naidoo-Rauf
candidates.why_elect: I can promise to listen, ask questions and word hard. I am a mum, wife, community pharmacist, business owner and charity founder; I am capable, sensible and I care. I can advocate for our communities—the young, elderly, families, businesses, the arts, ethnic groups, the affluent and most vulnerable.
candidates.why_stand: I want to help make Hamilton the best place to live and raise a family. I want to help people, reduce disparities, improve our communities and bring diversity to council. I care deeply for our children's future and the city we leave for them. Help me help you, Hamilton!

candidates.name: Rob Pascoe
candidates.why_elect: I am a good listener and team player, have training and experience, good governance skills, and am a lifelong resident of Hamilton. All or even some of these will help contribute good outcomes for the city.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Hamilton is a fantastic city, can achieve its potential, and I wish to part of a team adding value to achieve this.

candidates.name: Anna Smart
candidates.why_elect: I am a professional communicator and negotiator, and passionate community advocate. In my work as a real estate agent I am in and out of people's homes and neighbourhoods which gives me a unique understanding of the city and how each suburb ticks. I value community, integrity and people.
candidates.why_stand: For a balanced approach to growth, fiscal responsibility and a family-friendly, sustainable future. I love this city and believe Hamilton is the best place in NZ to raise a family, and we owe it to our children, and theirs, to ensure it continues to be.

candidates.name: Meleane Burgess
candidates.why_elect: I'm an accountant, a business woman with strong governance and community experience. I bring with me a diverse background and personal experience that will contribute immensely to robust discussions. I stand for fair and balanced council decision making. The three key principles that drive my priorities are affordable, family, safe.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our growing city and I strongly believe that Hamilton city council should represent the diversity of the cultures and viewpoint of the people that do live and work in Hamilton.

candidates.name: Maxine van Oosten
candidates.why_elect: I work as an advocate for teachers and education staff at NZEI Te Riu Roa. I have spent the last year fight alongside teachers for a fair pay rise. I've 20 years' experience in the finance sector and that makes me a valuable asset in financial debates.
candidates.why_stand: Fresh Ideas – Wise Head. You deserve better value for money from council and that's what I offer. I'll vote against any increase to the CEO's $440k salary. I'd rather see those on low incomes get a living wage.

candidates.name: Andrew Bydder
candidates.why_elect: I am not a politician. I have 25 years' experience in construction and project management, building things on time and on budget. I organise and supervise large teams of professionals, listening to the experts and making decisions for my clients. The people of Hamilton will be my new clients.
candidates.why_stand: Debt is rising 97% to fund 11% growth. That doesn't add up. Rates are rising 54% in the 10-Year Plan. CEO pay hike, $25 million to replace Founders Theatre, 20% more staff, and no accountability. There is a spending problem! I am worried about our future and housing affordability.

candidates.name: James Casson
candidates.why_elect: 28yrs police (20 in Hamilton) experience makes me a pragmatic thinker and a to the point person. I know injustice when I see it and there are a lot of areas where HCC can improve its service to residents. I am local and I have skin in the game.
candidates.why_stand: I am currently a first term councillor and I believe I have further work to do and continue with. I am passionate about serving Hamilton as I did for 20yrs as a Police Officer.

candidates.name: Tim Young
candidates.why_elect: As the only candidate with a Master of Science degree (and computer programming experience), I bring scientific literacy to help inform debate about fluoridation, climate action, and advances in technology. As the only wheelchair user, I have a lived experience that will improve accessibility for the disabled and aging population.
candidates.why_stand: To increase urgency about preparing for the effects of new technologies on our city. I can see the potential for our lives to be affected negatively if we're not proactive. Also, I don't see anyone else on Council with a physical disability pushing for increased accessibility and inclusion in society.

candidates.name: Margaret Forsyth
candidates.why_elect: I'm a Hamiltonian born and bred—and I'm really proud of that. Since graduating from Waikato University I've taught, policed, coached and taken up governance roles in Hamilton. I've got proven successful track record on Council. Hard work, humility, openness and teamwork are my core values.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for council because I want to continue with the projects I had success with on my last term—Destination playgrounds and the Bike Plan. I want to continue to serve my community. It would be a great honour to be re-elected to council.
